/particle-physics/elementary-particles.title: elementary particles
/particle-physics/elementary-particles.content:
They are [[particle physics/subatomic particles|subatomic particles]] that are not composed of other particles.

Current elementary particles:
- [[particle physics/fermions|fermions]]
- [[particle physics/bosons|bosons]]

/particle-physics/fermions.title: fermions
/particle-physics/fermions.content:
A particle that has a half-odd-integer spin (spin 1/2, spin 3/2, etc.)

Fermions include:
- [[particle physics/quarks|quarks]]
- [[particle physics/leptons|leptons]]

/particle-physics/leptons.title: leptons
/particle-physics/leptons.content:
A lepton is an elementary particle with spin 1/2 that does not interact strongly ([[strong interactions]])

Two main types of leptons:
- charged leptons: [[particle physics/electrons|electrons]] (first generation), [[particle physics/muons|muons]] (second generation), [[particle physics/tauons|tauons]] (third generation)
- neutral leptons: [[particle physics/neutrinos|neutrinos]]

/particle-physics/neutrinos.title: neutrinos
/particle-physics/neutrinos.content:
Neutrinos are [fermions](https://astrosw.github.io/quartz/particle-physics/fermions) that only interact through [[weak interactions]] and [[gravity]].

They are electrically neutral and have very small rest mass.

/particle-physics/subatomic-particles.title: subatomic particles
/particle-physics/subatomic-particles.content:
Particles that compose an atom.

A subatomic particle can be either a [[particle physics/composite particles|composite particle]] (made up of other particles, such as a proton, neutron, or meson) or an [[particle physics/elementary particles|elementary particle]] (made up of no other particles).
